body:
I can confirm that something seems to have broken regarding the setting. In my test environment using just the basic Syncthing binary (so no permission issues that could be caused by the Windows installer, etc.), it doesn't seem to be able to detect the junction content at all.

I'm going to try investigating which specific version and possibly commit (or maybe a Go upgrade) is responsible for the regression.

rename.from: Junctions as dirs doesn't work anymore ?
rename.to: Junctions as dirs doesn't work anymore

body: 8dc826b23 / #9651 is probably a good starting point
I can confirm that after compiling Syncthing v1.28.0 with Go v1.22, junctions work again, so the culprit is in Go v1.23.

> I can confirm that after compiling Syncthing v1.28.0 with Go v1.22, junctions work again, so the culprit is in Go v1.23.

@tomasz1986 The unit tests succeed, so it appears the test may be flawed too. I can look into fixing this, but don't want to duplicate effort if someone has already taken this on.
My capabilities are very limited, so please go on if you know how to approach the problem ðŸ™‚.

The unit tests still succeed with go 1.23, so they will need to be fixed too. I'm testing on Windows 11, so this might be a Windows 10 only bug. I can spin up the same Windows 10 VM I used when I tested
https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/pull/9651/commits/c29112d2e1b4066d47214ef0917112d8a78cccbe

@hardtopnet Can you run
```
ver
```
on the command line, and tell us what it outputs?

Certainly.
All three PC's are running `Microsoft Windows [version 10.0.19045.5011]` 
Cheers

Here's what we're seeing on junctions:
```
go 1.23:
stat: Mode()=drwxr-xr-x (0o020000000755)
lstat:Mode()=?rw-r--r-- (    0o02000644)
go 1.22.6:
stat: Mode()=drwxr-xr-x (0o020000000755)
lstat:Mode()=Lrw-r--r-- ( 0o01000000644)
```
Gotta drill into this a bit more....
I can confirm NTFS junction are also broken under Windows 11 24H2 as well.

issue.title: Is JunctionAsDirs working as expected in 1.28?
issue.body:
I have a folder that is shared between a Windows machine running SyncTrayzor and an Android device with Syncthing-fork.
- On the Windows side, the folder contains a junction and in the Advanced Settings the folder still has the JunctionsAsDirs flag set to on.
- On the Android device, the junction appears as a folder, but the contents have completely disappeared.
- The size of the folder displayed by both Syncthing clients is smaller than it should be.

Up until a few weeks ago, everything has been working as expected, the Android device has not received Syncthing-fork updates in a while, it's still at 1.27.9 which should be the last version on F-Droid, despite being a few versions behind the official client.

Windows is set to automatically update from syncthing.net and has received 1.28. 1.27.11 came out at the beginning of September, and I think everything was still fine back then.

I tried flipping the JunctionAsDirs flag, rescanning, restarting to no avail.

The SyncTrayzor logs go back to October, 17, while Android has detailed logs until October, 23, but I could find nothing useful. After enabling fs, scanner, walkfs, watchaggregator in the Debugging Facitilies and rescanning again, very little of use:

```
[dev_id] 2024/10/24 time_of_day walkfs.go:84: DEBUG: walk: path=junction_name
```

Am I wrong in thinking something has gone wrong on the Windows client's side recently?

body:
I juste submit [another bug](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/9784#issue-2612685182) where my folders doesn't synchronise properly since the v1.28.0.
I don't use junction but I think it can be related to GO 1.23 update too.
I also seem to have this issue. It's not working on Windows 10 and Windows 11 for me.

issue.title: fix(fs): fix directory junction handling (fixes #9775)
issue.body:
### Purpose

This fixes #9775. I also improved the comments as they were lacking.

My apologies for introducing this bug. In summary, the bug was
```
mode = mode ^ (ModeSymlink | ModeIrregular)
```
didn't correctly reset those bits. This correctly resets them:
```
mode = mode &^ ModeSymlink &^ ModeIrregular
```
Tested and working in Windows 11 version 10.0.22631.4317. I didn't test in other versions, but I'm sure this is the only issue.

issue.title: junctionsAsDirs not working

issue.body:
### What happened?

I just cannot make Syncthing to go down the directory junctions in my folder.

I've set junctionsAsDirs to true, I've tried pause/unpause, I've tried restarting Syncthing.
I'm creating junctions with `mklink /J dst src`

Am I missing something? Can I enable any logging that will help me understand what's going on?

I've tried STTRACE=walker but I see basically nothing of value when I press re-scan of that folder where I have my junctions:

```
[PM2LM] 2024/10/29 00:08:44.809505 walk.go:124: DEBUG: walker/6mezc-ujfk2@0xc002b1e6e0 Walk [] Matcher/[]@0xc0010983f0
```
